greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest multiple of n which is a perfect power (at least a square) of a squarefree number.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: If n = p^a*q^b*r^c... p, q, r are primes and max(a, b, c, ...) = K then a(n) = p^K*q^K*r^K...
mathematica: a[n_] := (Times @@ First@#)^(Max[Max @@ Last@#, 2]) &@ Transpose @ FactorInteger[n]; Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Feb 23 2021 *)
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Sep 03 2003
